document.docTitle: Speocarcinus amazonicus Brandao, Tavares and Coelho-Filho 2010
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Speocarcinus Stimpson, 1859 (Crustacea: Brachyura: Xanthidae), with a key to its species and the description of one new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the genus Speocarcinus Stimpson, 1859 (Crustacea: Brachyura: Xanthidae), with a key to its species and the description of one new species

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. A–B, D, E, Habitus, dorsal view. C, Lateral view of right cheliped. A–B,
Speocarcinus carolinensis Stimpson, 1859
. A, adult male cl 29 mm, cw 39 mm (USNM 251311). B, young male cl 10 mm, cw 14 mm (USNM 180101). C–E,
Speocarcinus dentatus
n. sp .
C–D, Adult male holotype cl 11.5 mm, cw 22.5 mm (MZUSP 12615). E, Young male paratype cl 9 mm, cw 17 mm (MZUSP 11007). Note the variation in the patterns in carapace dentition between adult and young individuals. Scale bars: A–B, D, 10 mm; C, E, 2 mm.

FIGURE 2. A–B, Lateral view of right and left chelipeds, respectively. C–H, Habitus, dorsal view. A, C,
Speocarcinus amazonicus Brandão, Tavares & Coelho-Filho, 2010
, holotype male cl 8 mm, cw 11 mm (MZUSP 23654). B, D,
Speocarcinus granulimanus Rathbun, 1894
, lectotype male cl 17.5 mm, cw 21 mm (USNM 17461). E,
Speocarcinus lobatus Guinot, 1969
, holotype male cl 16 mm, cw 12 mm (USNM 101081). F,
Speocarcinus meloi D’Incao & Silva, 1991
, holotype male cl 12 mm, cw 15.6 mm (MZUSP 9577). G,
Speocarcinus monotuberculatus Felder & Rabalais, 1986
, holotype female cl 6 mm, cw 7.8 mm (USNM 228459). H,
Speocarcinus spinicarpus Guinot, 1969
, male holotype cl 16 mm, cw 19 mm (USNM 231701). Note the differences in the chelipeds inner carpal spines. Scale bars: C–F, H, 10 mm; G, 2.5 mm.

FIGURE 3. A–D, Carapace, lateral view. A,
Speocarcinus amazonicus Brandão, Tavares & Coelho-Filho, 2010
, holotype male cl 8 mm, cw 11 mm (MZUSP 23654). B,
Speocarcinus carolinensis Stimpson, 1859
, male cl 10 mm, cw 14 mm (USNM 180101). C,
Speocarcinus dentatus
n. sp .
, male holotype cl 11.5 mm, cw 22.5 mm (MZUSP 12615). D,
Speocarcinus lobatus Guinot, 1969
, male cl 5 mm, cw 10 mm (USNM 187191). E–F, Carapace, fronto-lateral view. E,
Speocarcinus amazonicus Brandão, Tavares & Coelho-Filho, 2010
, holotype male cl 8 mm, cw 11 mm (MZUSP 23654). F,
Speocarcinus meloi D’Incao & Silva, 1991
, holotype male cl 12 mm, cw 15.6 mm (MZUSP 9577). Note the differences in the granulation pattern on the branchiostegal region. Scale bars: A, D–F, 5 mm; B, 2.5 mm; C, 2 mm.

FIGURE 4. A–B, Carapace, orbital region. C–E, Carapace, dorsal view of fronto-orbital region. A, D,
Speocarcinus carolinensis Stimpson, 1859
, male cl 10 mm, cw 14 mm (USNM 180101). B, E,
Speocarcinus dentatus
n. sp .
, male holotype cl 11.5 mm, cw 22.5 mm (MZUSP 12615). C,
Speocarcinus amazonicus Brandão, Tavares & Coelho-Filho, 2010
, holotype male cl 8 mm, cw 11 mm (MZUSP 23654). Note the differences in the granulation pattern on the ocular peduncle and on the frontal region of the carapace. Scale bars: A–B, E 2 mm; C–D, 5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. Contrary to
Brandão et al . ( 2010 )
the carapace branchiostegal regions of
S. amazonicus
and
S. lobatus
have only one transversal row of distinct granules. The second row mentioned by
Brandão et al . ( 2010 )
is actually considered herein to be part of the branchiostegal margin.

Distribution. Presently known from Martinique and Brazil (Amapá, Pará, Alagoas, Sergipe, Rio de Janeiro, Santa Catarina, and Rio Grande do Sul) on sand-muddy bottoms, between 23 and
130 m .
